subject: Our Queen Is Cast...
event:
... but I can't tell you who she is.

Only who she isn't.

She has no lines in common with Mr. Miyagi, but maybe she should.  If we were playing "Six Degrees," there would only be one link between us. Her mother and Big Ben are strangers.

comments.article:
Aali Mills is Cersei?
Hmmmm too obvious...
SHit make that Elisabeth Shue?
OOO OO I GOT IT! Hilary swank was in Karate kid. Is it her?
Is that Mr. Miyagi from Karate Kid?
It could be Lisa Shue...she would be perfect I agree.  IMDB shows her available after having just finished Piranha 3-D, but has a rumored part in The Hard Ride which is still in pre-production.
comments.subject: Elisabeth Shue?

comments.upictitle: Popular series of fiction, fancy, and fact.: The classic madbard
comments.article: Pat Morita in drag! A daring choice.
That would be a zombie Pat Morita in drag. He died in 2005.

Ok,got it!
Getting on the job right away!

I am no good at deciphering all of these cryptic comments. As a form of catharsis I am going to start generating my own.

"The purple frog howls at the reindeer under the azure moon".

No it doesn't mean anything, but I feel darn good after having said it! :)
comments.subject: Aaagh!

comments.article: ROFL!  I needed that.  I also never have the slightest effing clue, but it's fun to read everyone else's guesses.
comments.subject: Re: Aaagh!

comments.article: Hmmm...just off the top of my head (and a quick IMDB search), I have three possible names:  Elizabeth Shue, Hilary Swank (not bloody likely) and Robyn Lively.  All three are about the right age and were involved in one or more of the "Karate Kid" films.

"Shue is married to Davis Guggenheim, director of the HBO TV series Deadwood"

So, not exactly out of the realms of possibility... but could she pull off the bitchiness?

That's got to be it, she (Hilary) is a friend of yours isn't she?
*wishes I was a friend of yours...*
Good luck Hilary! Break a leg seems to be in order.
Good choice Nina and crew. So far the cast is exemplary.
Now what are we going to speculate about now that you have all the main characters cast?
I imagine the traffic on WIC will die down. LOL
Or not, we will have season 2 cast for you before the pilot is released.
What will you tease us about now?

Michelle Pfeiffer.

I have no idea how she relates, clue-wise, but I just like the idea.
She would be magnificent.
I'm starting to believe that it is Lisa Shue. Her husband has connections at HBO. He directed "Deadwood." I'm wondering if her mother and Ben Roethlesburger were from the same town in Ohio?

I'm guessing it's Sophia Myles.  Ron Perlman is the link between Martin and her and she was in a movie with Pat Morita where they didnt have lines spoken to each other.  And she isn't burdened with an english accent like Elizabeth Shue and Hillary Swank and has worked in television recently.  I don't really see her as a villian though.....
comments.subject: Cersei

comments.article: I think you're right.  Just looked up Sophia on Wikipedia.  She's English, but her mother's family is Russian, ergo the "Stranger to Big Ben" reference.
comments.subject: Re: Cersei

comments.article: I was thinking Sophia Myles as well.  Her IMDB page says her maternal grandmother is Russian, so maybe her mother was not born in England, making her a stranger to Big Ben the clock, rather than Big Ben the quarterback.  And the Ron Perlman reference is spot on for her.
And if you think she can't play ice princess, check her out in Underworld.  That's Cersei to me.

I think I know who she is. The Six Degrees clue may reffer to the Six Degrees series and obviously, the Miyagui one reffers to Pat Morita. The only actress playing in Six Degrees that has worked with Pat Morita (in Robot Chicken) is....

Erika Christensen!!!
"She has no lines in common with Mr. Miyagi, but maybe she should." Pat Morita and Erika Christensen didn't really ACT together. Only their voices were used in Robot Chicken. It makes sense to me! :)

One degree of separation. Beauty and the Beast
Linda Hamilton.

Its a wild guess, but I'm sticking to it.
Reading this on Wednesday, I'm in awe of how close this guess turned out to be, sorta! :)
why do you do this ser martin ;_;

She has no lines in common with Mr. Miyagi, but maybe she should.

You people are all looking at this the wrong way. It's not a Karate Kid link, it's a dialogue link. You should be looking for people who should have made remarks about waxing. I'm thinking Elizabeth Banks, who upon seeing Steve Carell's chest in 40-Year-Old Virgin could have remarked, "Wax on, wax off."

Other possibilities:
"No such thing as bad student, only bad teacher. Teacher say, student do." -- Michelle Pfeiffer, Dangerous Minds

"Now use head for something other than target." -- Milla Jovovich, Resident Evil

"Secret to punch, make power of whole body fit inside one inch, here. Power, whole body, one inch, here. Now, punch. Hard. " -- Uma Thurman, Kill Bill
But this post is still hilarious.  I especially liked the Milla Jovovich line.
comments.subject: I'm not convinced by any of those possibilities...

comments.article:
Hmm, I was just at Mr. Miyagi's restaurant today, too.


I'm more curious about who is going to play Old Tom.
comments.subject: Hmm

comments.article: Because of the 'Six Degrees of Separation' line, now if it's NOT Tricia Helfer I'm going to have to kill myself as she's my dream casting for Cersei. Can't make any of the other connections work though.

jenna jameson...

shes blonde... shes a whore....

okay so that's not my real guess... but i felt like throwing that one out there

comments.upictitle: David Alexander McDonald (Steven E. McDonald): Typewriter Obama Stylee
comments.article: Because I'm perverse...Linda Hamilton.
Heather Graham? (She was in Six Degrees of Separation!)
